00032 #include "xid_device_config_t.h"
00033 #include <Windows.h>
00034 #include <iostream>
00035 
00036 #include "string_tokenizer.hpp"
00037 
00038 boost::shared_ptr<cedrus::xid_device_config_t>
00039     cedrus::xid_device_config_t::config_for_device(
00040         int product_id,
00041         int model_id,
00042         const std::wstring &devconfig_location)
00043 {
00044     boost::shared_ptr<xid_device_config_t> devconfig;
00045     
00046     if(product_id == -99 || model_id == -99)
00047     {
00048         // invalid product or model id
00049         return devconfig;
00050     }
00051 
00052     if(devconfig_location.empty())
00053     {
00054         // no path to devconfig files.  Won't be able to load them so return
00055         // an invalid
00056         return devconfig;
00057     }
00058 
00059     devconfig.reset(new xid_device_config_t(devconfig_location));
00060     
00061     devconfig->load_devconfig(product_id, model_id);
00062 
00063     return devconfig;
00064 }
00065 
00066 cedrus::xid_device_config_t::xid_device_config_t(
00067     const std::wstring &config_file_location)
00068     : config_file_location_(config_file_location),
00069       needs_interbyte_delay_(true),
00070       number_of_lines_(8)
00071 {
00072 }

00074 
00075 cedrus::xid_device_config_t::~xid_device_config_t(void)
00076 {
00077 }
00078 
00079 void cedrus::xid_device_config_t::load_devconfig(int product_id, int model_id)
00080 {
00081     std::wstring search_mask = config_file_location_ + L"*.devconfig";
00082     WIN32_FIND_DATA file_info;
00083     HANDLE find_handle = FindFirstFile(
00084         search_mask.c_str(),
00085         &file_info);
00086 
00087     while(find_handle)
00088     {
00089         long device_id = -1;
00090         std::string device_name;
00091         long xid_product_id = -1;
00092         long xid_model_id = -1;
00093         std::string digital_output_command;
00094         std::wstring ignored_ports;
00095 
00096         wchar_t result[1024];
00097 
00098         std::wstring full_file_path = config_file_location_ +
00099             file_info.cFileName;
00100 
00101         xid_product_id = GetPrivateProfileInt(
00102             L"DeviceInfo",
00103             L"XidProductID",
00104             0,
00105             full_file_path.c_str());
00106 
00107         xid_model_id = GetPrivateProfileInt(
00108             L"DeviceInfo",
00109             L"XidModelID",
00110             0,
00111             full_file_path.c_str());
00112 
00113         if(xid_product_id == product_id &&
00114            xid_model_id == model_id)
00115         {
00116             // we've found the configuration for this device
00117 
00118             // does this device need an interbyte delay?
00119             if(GetPrivateProfileString(
00120                 L"DeviceOptions",
00121                 L"XidNeedsInterByteDelay",
00122                 L"No",
00123                 result,
00124                 sizeof(result),
00125                 full_file_path.c_str()) != 0)
00126             {
00127                 std::wstring byte_delay(result);
00128                 
00129                 if(byte_delay.compare(L"Yes") == 0)
00130                 {
00131                     needs_interbyte_delay_ = true;
00132                 }
00133             }
00134 
00135             wchar_t port_str[255];
00136             
00137             // xid devices support up to 255 ports.  In reality, usually only
00138             // 2 or 3 are used
00139             for(int i = 0; i <= 255; ++i)
00140             {
00141                 wsprintf(port_str, L"Port%d", i);
00142 
00143                 int return_size = GetPrivateProfileSection(
00144                     port_str,
00145                     result,
00146                     sizeof(result),
00147                     full_file_path.c_str());
00148                 if(return_size == 0)
00149                 {
00150                     // section not found.  This should be impossible to get to.
00151                     continue;
00152                 }
00153 
00154                 // The result of GetPrivateProfileSection() is a an array of
00155                 // NULL delimited strings.  Here we create a response std::string
00156                 // with the contents of the result[] array with nulls replaced
00157                 // by commas for easier tokenizing.
00158                 std::wstring res_str;
00159                 res_str.reserve(return_size);
00160                 for(int j = 0; j < return_size; ++j)
00161                 {
00162                     if(result[j] != 0)
00163                     {
00164                         res_str.append(1, result[j]);
00165                     }
00166                     else
00167                     {
00168                         if(j != (return_size-1))
00169                             res_str.append(1, L',');
00170                     }
00171                 }
00172 
00173                 // Tokenize the result into Key=Value strings.
00174                 std::vector<std::wstring> key_value_pairs =
00175                     cedrus::tokenize<std::wstring>(res_str,L",");
00176                 
00177                 // turn the Key=Value strings into a std::map
00178                 std::map<std::wstring, std::wstring> res_map;
00179                 for(std::vector<std::wstring>::iterator iter = key_value_pairs.begin();
00180                     iter != key_value_pairs.end(); ++iter)
00181                 {
00182                     std::vector<std::wstring> key_value = 
00183                         cedrus::tokenize<std::wstring>(*iter, L"=");
00184 
00185                     res_map.insert(std::make_pair(key_value[0],key_value[1]));
00186                 }
00187 
00188                 std::map<std::wstring,std::wstring>::iterator found = 
00189                     res_map.find(L"PortName");
00190 
00191                 if(found == res_map.end())
00192                 {
00193                     // no port name found.  Try the next one
00194                     continue;
00195                 }
00196 
00197                 if(found->second.compare(L"Keys") == 0 ||
00198                    found->second.compare(L"Voice Key") == 0)
00199                 {
00200                     // found a RB-Series response pad, Lumina system,
00201                     // or SV-1 Voice Key.
00202                     found = res_map.find(L"NumberOfLines");
00203                     if(found != res_map.end())
00204                     {
00205                         number_of_lines_ = _wtoi(found->second.c_str());
00206                     }
00207                 
00208                     // devconfig files have up to 8 key mappings
00209                     for(int i = 1; i <=8; ++i)
00210                     {
00211                         wchar_t key_name[100];
00212                         memset(key_name, 0, sizeof(key_name));
00213                         wsprintf(key_name,L"XidDeviceKeyMap%d", i);
00214                         
00215                         found = res_map.find(std::wstring(key_name));
00216                         if(found != res_map.end())
00217                         {
00218                             int key_num = _wtoi(found->second.c_str());
00219                             key_map_.insert(std::make_pair(i, key_num));
00220                         }
00221                     }
00222                 }
00223                 else
00224                 {
00225                     // no valid port found. Try the next one.
00226                     continue;
00227                 }
00228             }
00229         }
00230 
00231         if(!FindNextFile(find_handle, &file_info))
00232             break;
00233     }
00234 
00235     FindClose(find_handle);
00236 }
00237 
00238 int cedrus::xid_device_config_t::get_mapped_key(int key) const
00239 {
00240     if(key_map_.empty())
00241         return key;
00242 
00243     std::map<int,int>::const_iterator found = 
00244         key_map_.find(key);
00245 
00246     if(found == key_map_.end())
00247         return -1;
00248 
00249     return found->second;
00250 }
00251 
00252 int cedrus::xid_device_config_t::number_of_lines() const
00253 {
00254     return number_of_lines_;
00255 }
00256 
00257 bool cedrus::xid_device_config_t::needs_interbyte_delay() const
00258 {
00259     return needs_interbyte_delay_;
00260 }
